task.title: Manage Compliance Groups
task.shortdesc: Compliance groups are created and then assigned to employees. On the Team Schedule page, managers receive a warning if they break any of the compliance rules when assigning shifts.

taskbody.context:
Compliance groups are assigned to employees through the new hire wizard and through the employee's persona page (My Team > select employee name > Schedule tab).
My TeamWorkforce ManagementSchedulingSettingsCompliance Groups

step.cmd: Select Add Rule to add the compliance rules that apply to this group; the rules listed in the Rule drop-down list are system-delivered. (In order for the rules to apply, the employee must be part of the compliance group [Team Schedule > select employee > Schedule tab].)

ul.li: Conflicts with Employee Labor Metric (Error) - Validates if the labor metrics of a shift assigned to an employee are included in the employee’s labor metric group assignment. If there is a mismatch, the rule prevents the schedule from being published.

Conflicts with Employee Labor Metric (Warning) - Validates if the labor metrics of a shift assigned to an employee are included in the employee’s labor metric group assignment. If there is a mismatch, the rule presents a warning message but allows the schedule to be published.
Conflicts with Time Off Requests - Ensures the schedule does not conflict with an employee's time off requests.
Maximum Gap Between Shifts - Ensures the set number of hours between shifts is respected.
Maximum/Minimum Weekly Hours – Creates compliance violations around maximum and minimum hours per week (maximum is 40h 00m).
Maximum Shift Spread – Represents the total duration of hours between two shifts of an employee (maximum is less than 12h 00m).
Minimum Rest Between Shifts – Ensures that minimum rest is ensured. Employees must have at least 2h 00m rest between scheduled shifts.
Maximum/Minimum Shift Length – Creates violation around shift length (X hours).
Total Scheduled Hours – Total hours of a day (X hours).

step.cmd: Select the labor metrics that are required.
Define what constitutes a day for the compliance calculations. A day starts at the time the first shift started and ends at +24:00 hours. Otherwise, a day resets at midnight (00:00).

step.info:
To edit a compliance group, select a group link in the Name column. You can edit the name and description and add or remove a compliance rule.
To delete a compliance group, select a group link in the Name column. Select Delete Group and then Delete again when asked for confirmation.
